annotation.TEXT: Finally, for beating this Doc Robot, you get the Energy Balancer. As implied before, all four of these upgrades are completely optional, but they do help out a decent amount. All that's left now is to tackle the last optional area/boss; Wave Man, who has obtained a much more fitting stage theme in this version.

Also, as a forewarning right now (for those of you that didn't read the description): Prepare for some awful playing against every single boss in this segment. I honestly don't have that much of an excuse for this, other than the fact that most of my concentration was aimed at the stages while playing this.

Much like the first time around, I'll be delving into the Doc Robot areas and Wave Man's segment before moving onto the actual fortress. For the most part, these sections have gotten overhauls in their enemy and hazard placements. They're still found in the same areas as the original however, along with retaining the same general paths as well.

Wave Torrent is still pretty decent as far as moderately strong projectiles go. The bursting effect is a bit different now, as the water droplets have a spreading effect rather than just falling off the screen. They still don't seem to contribute to much, unless you want to use this to hit an enemy diagonally above or below you (and not use the Shark Boomerang instead, for whatever reason).

The rewards for beating the Doc Robots are still the same, but for the sake of convenience, I'll go over them again: Beating the Doc Robot in Blade Man's stage makes energy pick-up's give you double the amount back. While not overly necessary, it definitely helps out (and it goes nicely with the upgrade you can get from Torch Man's stage).

Further demonstrating that I had no idea what I was doing during the boss fights, I definitely should have deactivated my shield before going in. Wave Man isn't susceptible to the Volt Buckler anymore. Instead, he's weak to the Shark Boomerang (which I can't help but find a bit odd, considering the whole water-to-water themes behind both bosses).

For anyone who's curious: The path off to the right in this section leads to a small room filled with goodies (two extra lives, an E-Tank, and a bunch of weapon energy). I passed it up mainly because I felt it was too risky to go for it (seeing as you need to time your movements right or instantly die to the green gunk below).

For beating the Doc Robot in this stage, your buster gains a split-shot effect. Whenever a buster pellet hits something (or the edge of the screen), it'll split into two more shots that travel at slight diagonal inclines. Even though the hit sound is quite blaring, this upgrade can still be useful for taking down enemies a bit quicker.

For beating this Doc Robot, you get an upgrade to your ammo reserves; All of your weapons effectively have twice the amount of usage now. For example, the Volt Buckler now has 8 shots instead of 4 (still a pretty low amount for that particular weapon, but at least it's more viable now).
